fields.name: verified_primary_email
fields.description: If the primary email address on the record has been verified.

fields.name: verified_email
fields.description: If any email address on the record has been verified, this will be set to true (to verify an email address the user must prove they have access to that email address inbox by following a link sent to them).

fields.name: deactivation_date
fields.description: The date and time when the ORCID Record was deactivated. (If the account is active, this field will be NULL.)

fields.name: host
fields.description: ORCID host (base URL) of the ORCID iD.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path is the ORCID iD, section, and put-code and is used when reading the individual item.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: ORCID URI for the ORCID iD.

fields.name: source_client_id
fields.description: The client ID for the client application (Member organization system) that created the item.

fields.name: source_name
fields.description: The human-readable name of the client application (Member organization system) or individual user that created the item. Value for the same person/organization could change over time. source-orcid or source-client-id fields are more appropriate for disambiguated matching.

fields.name: host
fields.description: ORCID host (base URL) of the ORCID iD.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path is the ORCID iD, section, and put-code and is used when reading the individual item.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: ORCID URI for the ORCID iD.

fields.name: source_orcid
fields.description: The ORCID identifier for the individual user (or legacy client application) that created the item. For identifiers of tindividual users, it may be used to look up ORCID record details via the API.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Source.

fields.name: submission_date
fields.description: The date the record was created by the user if the creation method is Direct, Website, or Member-referred, or if the creation method is API; it is the date the researcher claimed the record.

fields.name: claimed
fields.description: Shows that the record has been claimed by the researcher. All records created by the researcher will have this field set to true. Only records created by an institution for a researcher and which have not been accessed by the researcher will have the claimed status set to false.

fields.name: last_modified_date
fields.description: The date time when the element was last modified.

fields.name: completion_date
fields.description: Only returned on records with a creation method of API, this date is when the user took control of the record and set a password.

fields.name: creation_method
fields.description: How the record was created. The options are "Direct" or "Website" - when a user signed up for the record directly at https://orcid.org/register; "Member-referred" - when the user was sent to the ORCID OAuth registration page by a client integration and signed up as part of granting authorization; or "API" - when the record was created on behalf of the researcher by their institution (The API create process is no longer supported by ORCID)

name: history
description: The history section has information about the creation and state of the record.

name: path
description: The path is the ORCID iD, section, and put-code and is used when reading the individual item.

fields.name: locale
fields.description: For the up to date supported locale list see https://github.com/ORCID/ORCID-Source/SUPPORTED_LOCALES.md

name: preferences
description: Preferences set by the researcher or contributor. (currently language preference)

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path is the ORCID iD, section, and put-code and is used when reading the individual item.

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: Visibility indicates the privacy setting of the item, based on the user's set visibility preference.

fields.name: review_group_id
fields.description: Identifier for the group that this review should be a part of for aggregation purposes

fields.name: day
fields.description: 2-digit integer representing a day of a date.

fields.name: month
fields.description: 2-digit integer representing a month of a date.

fields.name: year
fields.description: 4-digit integer representing a year of a date.

fields.name: completion_date
fields.description: The date on which the review was completed. Allowable values: yyyy; yyyy-mm; yyyy-mm-dd, formatted using the ORCID fuzzy date format.

fields.name: last_modified_date
fields.description: The date time when the element was last modified.

fields.name: review_type
fields.desription: The kind of review. Options for this field are: evaluation, review.

fields.name: display_index
fields.description: The display index.

fields.name: created_date
fields.description: The date time when element was created.

fields.name: reviewer_role
fields.description: The role played by a person in their contribution to a review. Options for this field are: chair, editor, member, organizer, reviewer.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path is the ORCID iD, section, and put-code and is used when reading the individual item.

fields.name: put_code
fields.description: The put-code attribute is present only when reading elements. The code must be used when PUTing (updating) items that contain the attribute (works, affiliations, etc) to ensure that the existing item's history is retained.

fields.name: review_url
fields.description: A link to a representation of the review on the web. This URL refers to the review itself, NOT to the item that was reviewed.

fields.name: external_id_relationship
fields.description: Indicates the relationship type, selected from the following options: part-of, self ,version-of. ORCID will validate this value against the enumeration https://github.com/ORCID/orcid-model/blob/master/src/main/java/org/orcid/jaxb/model/common/Relationship.java and other rules when necessary.

fields.name: external_id_url
fields.description: Represents a URL in the XML anyURI format.

fields.name: transient
fields.description: A string that is flagged as transient i.e. populated by ORCID, not the source.

fields.name: value
fields.description: External id normalized value

fields.name: external_id_normalized
fields.description: The normalized external id.

fields.name: external_id_value
fields.description: The external id value.

fields.name: external_id_normalized_error
fields.description: The external id normalized error.

fields.name: external_id_type
fields.description: The external id type.

fields.name: external_id
fields.description: A reference to an external identifier, suitable for works, people and funding. Supported external-id-type values can be found at https://pub.orcid.org/v2.0/identifiers

fields.name: external_ids
fields.description: Container for storing external ids.

fields.name: disambiguation_source
fields.description: The source for providing the disambiguated organization ID. For the list of allowed sources see https://github.com/ORCID/ORCID-Source/blob/master/orcid-core/src/main/java/org/orcid/core/orgs/OrgDisambiguatedSourceType.java

fields.name: disambiguated_organization_identifier
fields.description: The disambiguated organization identifier.

fields.name: disambiguated_organization
fields.description: A reference to a disambiguated version the organization to which the researcher or contributor is affiliated. The list of disambiguated organizations come from ORCID partners such as Ringgold, ISNI and FundRef.

fields.name: country
fields.description: Country represented by its ISO 3611 code. The visibility attribute (private, limited or public) can be set at record creation, and indicates who can see this section of information.

fields.name: region
fields.description: Region within a country.

fields.name: city
fields.description: City.

fields.name: address
fields.description: Container for address information. Only country information is included at this time.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Organization name.

fields.name: convening_organization
fields.description: Information about the organization convening the review (journal publisher, conference organizer, funding agency, etc). A valid organizational identifier (Ringgold ID, GRID ID or FundRef ID is required).

fields.name: host
fields.description: ORCID host (base URL) of the ORCID iD.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path is the ORCID iD, section, and put-code and is used when reading the individual item.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: ORCID URI for the ORCID iD.

fields.name: assertion_origin_orcid
fields.description: The ORCID identifier for the individual user (or legacy client application) made the assertion. If missing, source is the same as assertion origin.

fields.description: Country represented by its ISO 3611 code. The visibility attribute (private, limited or public) can be set at record creation, and indicates who can see this section of information.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: A reference to an organization. An organization should contain a disambiguated organization, which uniquely identifies the organization. While the schema does not enforce the presence of a disambiguated organization, it is only optional for peer review convening organizations. A disambiguated organization is mandatory in all other cases where organization is required in the schema.

May be designated as in progress or unfinished/ The put-code attribute is returned when reading this element. When updating the item, the put-code attribute must be included to indicate the specific item to be updated.

ORCID will validate this value against the enumeration https://github.com/ORCID/orcid-model/blob/master/src/main/java/org/orcid/jaxb/model/common/Relationship.java and other rules when necessary.

fields.name: external_id_url
fields.description: Represents a URL in the XML anyURI format.

fields.name: external_id_value
fields.description: The external id value.

fields.name: external_id_normalized_error
fields.description: The external id normalized error.

fields.name: external_id_type
fields.description: The external id type.

fields.name: external_id
fields.description: A reference to an external identifier, suitable for works, people and funding. Supported external-id-type values can be found at https://pub.orcid.org/v2.0/identifiers

fields.name: external_ids
fields.description: Container for storing external ids.

fields.name: day
fields.description: 2-digit integer representing a day of a date.

fields.name: month
fields.description: 2-digit integer representing a month of a date.

fields.name: year
fields.description: 4-digit integer representing a year of a date.

fields.name: end_date
fields.description: The end date of the item

fields.name: last_modified_date
fields.description: The date time when the element was last modified.

fields.name: display_index
fields.description: The display index.

fields.name: created_date
fields.description: The date time when element was created.

fields.name: funding_summary
fields.description:
Funding received by the researcher or contributor. REQUIRED FIELDS: Funding-type, Funding-title, Funding Agency
				(organization). The put-code attribute is returned when reading this element. When updating the item, the put-code attribute must be included to indicate the specific item to be updated.

fields.name: host
fields.description: ORCID host (base URL) of the ORCID iD.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path is the ORCID iD, section, and put-code and is used when reading the individual item.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: ORCID URI for the ORCID iD.

fields.name: source_client_id
fields.description: The client ID for the client application (Member organization system) that created the item.

fields.name: source_name
fields.description: The human-readable name of the client application (Member organization system) or individual user that created the item. Value for the same person/organization could change over time. source-orcid or source-client-id fields are more appropriate for disambiguated matching.

fields.name: host
fields.description: ORCID host (base URL) of the ORCID iD.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path is the ORCID iD, section, and put-code and is used when reading the individual item.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: ORCID URI for the ORCID iD.

fields.name: source_orcid
fields.description: The ORCID identifier for the individual user (or legacy client application) that created the item. For identifiers of tindividual users, it may be used to look up ORCID record details via the API.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Source.

fields.name: disambiguation_source
fields.description: The source for providing the disambiguated organization ID. For the list of allowed sources see https://github.com/ORCID/ORCID-Source/blob/master/orcid-core/src/main/java/org/orcid/core/orgs/OrgDisambiguatedSourceType.java

fields.name: disambiguated_organization_identifier
fields.description: The disambiguated organization identifier.

fields.name: disambiguated_organization
fields.description: A reference to a disambiguated version the organization to which the researcher or contributor is affiliated. The list of disambiguated organizations come from ORCID partners such as Ringgold, ISNI and FundRef.

fields.name: country
fields.description: Country represented by its ISO 3611 code. The visibility attribute (private, limited or public) can be set at record creation, and indicates who can see this section of information.

fields.name: region
fields.description: Region within a country.

fields.name: city
fields.description: City.

fields.name: address
fields.description: Container for address information. Only country information is included at this time.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Organization name.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: A reference to an organization. An organization should contain a disambiguated organization, which uniquely identifies the organization. While the schema does not enforce the presence of a disambiguated organization, it is only optional for peer review convening organizations. A disambiguated organization is mandatory in all other cases where organization is required in the schema.

fields.name: day
fields.description: 2-digit integer representing a day of a date.

fields.name: month
fields.description: 2-digit integer representing a month of a date.

fields.name: year
fields.description: 4-digit integer representing a year of a date.

fields.name: start_date
fields.description: The start date.

fields.name: display_index
fields.description: The display index.

fields.name: created_date
fields.description: The date time when element was created.

fields.name: role_title
fields.description: The role title.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path is the ORCID iD, section, and put-code and is used when reading the individual item.

fields.name: put_code
fields.description: The put-code attribute is present only when reading elements. The code must be used when PUTing (updating) items that contain the attribute (works, affiliations, etc) to ensure that the existing item's history is retained.

fields.name: last_modified_date
fields.description: The date time when the element was last modified.

fields.name: department_name
fields.description: The department name.

fields.name: employment_summary
fields.description:
An employment associated with the researcher or contributor. Employment is defined as A formal employment affiliation with an organization - paid or unpaid.
				* The put-code attribute is returned when reading this element. When updating the item, the put-code attribute must be included to indicate the specific item to be updated.

fields.description: The client ID for the client application (Member organization system) that made the assertion. If missing, source is the same as assertion origin.

fields.name: assertion_origin_name
fields.description: The assertion origin name.

fields.name: source_name
fields.description: The human-readable name of the client application (Member organization system) or individual user that created the item. Value for the same person/organization could change over time. source-orcid or source-client-id fields are more appropriate for disambiguated matching.

fields.name: host
fields.description: ORCID host (base URL) of the ORCID iD.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path is the ORCID iD, section, and put-code and is used when reading the individual item.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: ORCID URI for the ORCID iD.

fields.name: source_orcid
fields.description: The ORCID identifier for the individual user (or legacy client application) that created the item. For identifiers of tindividual users, it may be used to look up ORCID record details via the API.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Source.

fields.name: created_date
fields.description: The date time when element was created.

fields.name: last_modified_date
fields.description: The date time when the element was last modified.

fields.name: content
fields.description: A name for the researcher.

fields.name: other_name
fields.description: Other name(s) that the researcher is or was known by. Max length is 255 characters

fields.name: source
fields.description: Source.

fields.name: credit_name
fields.description: The name to use for the researcher or contributor when credited or cited, for example, in an article or index, or as a funding contributor. The value of this field also is used as the display name for the researcher or contributor in the ORCID Registry in their ORCID Record, or when listed as a contributor on other ORCID Records. If this element is NULL, given-name family-name will be used for display purposes, with a visibility of 'public'. The visibility attribute (private, limited or public) can be set at record creation, and indicates who can see this section of information.

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: Visibility indicates the privacy setting of the item, based on the user's set visibility preference.

fields.name: family_name
fields.description: The family (last) name of the researcher. This element is optional, because some cultures only use given names.

fields.name: given_names
fields.description: The given name(s) of the researcher or contributor.

fields.name: last_modified_date
fields.description: The date time when the element was last modified.

fields.name: created_date
fields.description: The date time when element was created.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Container for the researcher's first and last name.

name: person
description: The biographical details of the researcher or contributor.
